info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 5 at 5:53PM EDT until June 5 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Leon.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Florida A and M, Florida State University, Tallahassee State College, Doak Campbell Stadium, Tallahassee Memorial Hosp, Winthrop Park, Governors Square Mall, Midtown, Lake Ella, Tom Brown Park, Indian Head Acres, Cascades Park, State Capital Complex, Kleman Plaza, Frenchtown, Levy Park, Leon County Civic Center, Macon Community Park and Market District. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
